summary: "TOI-3493 b is a promising candidate for transmission spectroscopy measurements for exoplanets, placed second to HD 191939 b on the metric scale," the authors of the paper wrote. More information: P. Chaturvedi et al, TOI-3493 b: A planet with a Neptune-like density transiting a bright G0-type star, arXiv (2025). "In this paper, we present the discovery of TOI-3493 b, a small exoplanet with a mass less than that of Neptune," the researchers wrote. When it comes to the star TOI-3493, it has a radius of about 1.23 solar radii and its mass is comparable to that of the sun.
